name: Dana and Lauren T-shirt
description:
Dana and Lauren T-shirt.  Available in small, medium, large, x-tra large.  Send an email to info@danaandlauren.com or include on your paypal payment which size shirt you would like.  

American Apparell T-shirt.  Made in the USA.

Short Sleeve Crew Neck.  The perfect 50/50 blend creates a soft and comfortable slim-fitting T-shirt. Its smooth surface is ideal for screen printing, embroidery and other embellishment. 

Poly-Cotton (50% Polyester / 50% Combed-Cotton) construction.

name: DANA and LAUREN - NEW 4 song EP - (Autographed)
description:
Dana and Lauren are proud to announce the release of their new self-titled 4 song EP, “Dana and Lauren.” The new record features an exciting mix of Country, Bluegrass and Americana that Napster.com called "Bluegrass-tastic!"   

The EP features a dynamic bluegrass cover of 2Pac and Dr. Dre's hip hop classic "California Love."  The rest of album consists of all original tracks including the driving and addictive country tune “Chasing Trains” (co-written by Lauren) that is sure to have you humming along and stomping your feet.  The Dana penned “Song To My Heart”, is a cheerful, smile inducing and irresistible upbeat love song.  The dreamy, lullaby-like “Dreams Are Fireflies” perfectly captures a sense of yearning, with lush and gorgeously layered harmonies.  

The album is produced by Ethan Allen (The upcoming Waylon Jennings Tribute with Dierks Bently, Trace Adkins, Sheryl Crow). 

Along with Dana and Lauren’s banjo and fiddle, the album features the amazing musicianship of Josh Moreau on bass (Katy Perry, Hoobastank), Chase Duddy (Ryan Cabrera) on drums, Ethan Kaufman (Ryan Cabrera) on guitar.

name: Shankman Twins - Duality - (Autographed)
description: At the age of 14, Dana and Lauren started their professional music career in their bluegrass band the Shankman Twins and released their debut album, Duality, a captivating mix of 15 bluegrass, country and cajun songs. Duality featured their hit song “Waterbound,” which stayed on the national bluegrass charts for a remarkable 15 months. The Shankman Twins were nominated for Emerging Artist of the Year by Bluegrass Now Magazine. An early supporter and fan was bluegrass legend Ralph Stanley, who was so impressed by their vocals, and spirited picking and bowing style that Stanley invited Dana and Lauren to perform as his special guest on many performances.
